inclusion.criterion: Type 2 diabetes for at least 6 months
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: family history is positive for type 2 diabetes (his father and sister)

inclusion.criterion: Taking 1 or more oral hypoglycemic agents
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patient attending your community pharmacy where you decided that addition of insulin glargine may be of benefit to the patient
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is a customer at the pharmacy

exclusion.criterion: Have used, or currently using, Insulin
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient is not taking insulin

exclusion.criterion: Renal impairment(Serum Creatinine: females ≥ 124 mmol/l, males ≥ 133 mmol/l)
exclusion.label: not_met
met
exclusion.evidence: The patient has a heart rate of 115/min and blood pressure 110/75 mmHg, but the lab results are remarkable for leukocytosis (19.5), urea of 8.5, high CRP (145), high amylase (1200) and Glc level of 15.

exclusion.criterion: Unwilling/unable to attend follow up visits
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has abdominal pain and vomiting, but cross-sectional imaging was negative for obstructive pancreatitis.
